Class ParseTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • ParseTree

  • public class ParseTree
extends java.lang.Object
    A skeleton class to represent parse trees. The arity is not fixed: a node can have 0, 1 or more children. Trees are represented in the following way: Tree :== Symbol * List In other words, trees are defined recursively: A tree is a root (with a label of type Symbol) and a list of trees children. Thus, a leave is simply a tree with no children (its list of children is empty). This class can also be seen as representing the Node of a tree, in which case a tree is simply represented as its root.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ParseTree(java.lang.String lbl, java.util.List<ParseTree> chdn)
      Creates a tree with root labeled by lbl and children chdn.
      ParseTree(Symbol lbl)
      Creates a singleton tree with only a root labeled by lbl.
      ParseTree(Symbol lbl, java.util.List<ParseTree> chdn)
      Creates a tree with root labeled by lbl and children chdn.

    • Method Detail

      • toLaTexTree

        public java.lang.String toLaTexTree()
        Writes the tree as LaTeX code

      • toTikZ

        public java.lang.String toTikZ()
        Writes the tree as TikZ code. TikZ is a language to specify drawings in LaTeX files.

      • toTeX

        public java.lang.String toTeX()
        Check each token and write it in the right latex syntax
        Returns:
        the right syntax in latex for each token

      • toTikZPicture

        public java.lang.String toTikZPicture()
        Writes the tree as a TikZ picture. A TikZ picture embeds TikZ code so that LaTeX undertands it.

      • toLaTeXLua

        public java.lang.String toLaTeXLua()
        Writes the tree as a LaTeX document which can be compiled (using the LuaLaTeX engine). Be careful that such code will not compile with PDFLaTeX, since the tree drawing algorithm is written in Lua. The code is not very readable as such, but you can have a look at the outputted file if you want to understand better.

        The result can be used with the command: 
         lualatex some-file.tex

      • toForestPicture

        public java.lang.String toForestPicture()
        Writes the tree as a forest picture. Returns the tree in forest enviroment using the latex code of the tree

      • toLaTeX

        public java.lang.String toLaTeX()
        Writes the tree as a LaTeX document which can be compiled using PDFLaTeX.

        The result can be used with the command: 
         pdflatex some-file.tex
